firstNightReminder: Show 1 character token from 3 character types, 1 of which is in-play.
name: Tailor - π
ability: You start knowing 1 character from 3 character types, 1 of which is in-play.
flavor: Sir Armun has ordered for such exquisite outfits to the circus. Such eccentric ones too. Is he the main event, a spectator or someone who wishes to disrupt the show?

firstNightReminder: Show the token of a Minion in-play.
otherNightReminder: The Star Pierce points to a player. Nod yes or shake no to indicate if they are the target.
name: Star Pierce - π
ability: You start knowing an in-play Minion. Each night*, guess who it is: learn if you're right.
flavor: Attack. Reduce cooldown of all Attack cards by 2

jinxes.reason: If the Star Pierce learns that the Vizier is in-play, the existence of the Vizier is not announced by the Storyteller.

firstNightReminder: Show Focus a piece of paper with the answer to the question.
name: Focus - π
ability: You start knowing the answer to a question. Each day, privately guess what it is: you learn how accurate you are.
flavor: Gain 3 Focus status

firstNightReminder: Show Jump Strike the character type of the marked player via the reminder tokens.
otherNightReminder: Show Jump Strike the character type of the marked player via the reminder tokens.
name: Jump Strike - π
ability: You start knowing a player's character type. Each night*, learn their next non-Traveller clockwise neighbor's character type. [+0 or +1 Outsider]
flavor: Attack twice. After the attack, if the card was placed in an odd-numbered position on the field, increase the Attack Power of this card by 1 & refuce cooldown by 4

jinxes.reason: If the Marionette thinks they are the Jump Strike, 1 Outsider might have been added.

firstNightReminder: The Cynic points to a player. If they are an evil character, show them that character token. Otherwise show them any evil character token.
otherNightReminder: The Cynic points to a player. If they are an evil character, show them that character token. Otherwise show them any evil character token.
name: Cynic- π
ability: Each night, choose a player: learn their character. Good characters register as evil characters to you.
flavor: That's what a Demon would say.

firstNightReminder: The Interceptor points to a good character. If it is in-play, point to 2 players, 1 of which is that character. Otherwise point to any 2 players.
otherNightReminder: The Interceptor points to a good character. If it is in-play, point to 2 players, 1 of which is that character. Otherwise point to any 2 players.
name: Interceptor - π
ability: Each night, choose a good character (not yours): learn that it is between 2 players. If not-in-play, learn false info.
flavor: Gotcha.

firstNightReminder: The Dazzle points to a player, mark them with the Chosen token. If that player is evil, wake that player, show them the "This character selected you" token, Dazzles token then point to Dazzle then put them to sleep. They are drunk.
otherNightReminder: The player previously chosen by Dazzle is no longer drunk. The Dazzle points to a player, different to last night. If that player is evil, wake that player, show them the "This character selected you" token, Dazzles token and point to Dazzle then put them to sleep. They are drunk.
name: Dazzle - π
ability: Each night, choose a player (different to last night): chosen evil players learn you are Dazzle & are drunk until dusk.
flavor: For this Phase: Reduce Attack Power of opponent cards by 4

jinxes.reason: The Marionette does not learn that the Dazzle chosen them.
If the Dazzle chose Riot on the 3rd night, on day 3, nominees die and nominate an alive player. This must happen.
If the Summoner is drunk on the 3rd night, the Summoner chooses which Demon but the Storyteller chooses which player.

firstNightReminder: Blitz points to 2 players and a character. If that character is amongst the 2, show them the other player's character token. If not, show them any other token.
otherNightReminder: Blitz points to 2 players and a character. If that character is amongst the 2, show them the other player's character token. If not, show them any other token.
name: Blitz - π
ability: Each night, guess a character is between 2 players (not you, a Traveller & different to last night): if correct, learn the other otherwise learn false info.
flavor: Attack twice if used in odd-numbered Phase

firstNightReminder: The Fine Maneuver points to a player. If that player is evil: mark the Fine Manuever with the True token. All Townsfolk are sober, healthy and their abilities must yield true information until dusk.
otherNightReminder: The Fine Maneuver points to a player, different to last night. If that player is evil: mark the Fine Manuever with the True token. All Townsfolk are sober, healthy and their abilities must yield true information until dusk.
name: Fine Maneuver - π
ability: Each night, choose a player (different to last night): if evil, all Townsfolk are sober, healthy & their abilities yield true info until dusk.
flavor: If the next card on the field is an Attack, heal by 6 HP. If its a Magic card, inflict 6 damage

jinxes.reason: The effects of a drunk or poisoned Alchemist's ability only takes place after Fine Maneuver's turn unless it would poison Fine Manuever.
If a drunk or poisoned Engineer uses their ability and the Fine Manuever chose an evil player the same night, the Engineer's ability will work.
The Overdrive learns info after the Fine Manuever's turn.
If the Fine Maneuver chooses an evil player the same night a drunk or poisoned Philospher uses their ability, their ability works as normal.
Minion and Demon info is delayed until after the Fine Manuever's turn if it is in-play and the Poppy Grower started out drunk or poisoned.
If a drunk or poisoned Preacher chooses a Minion the same night the Fine Manuever chooses an evil player, the Minion loses their ability and learns the Preacher chose them.

otherNightReminder: The Ammo Blast points to a player. If they are a Demon, kill the Ammo Blast and as many of the players they previously chose as you like. If not, mark them with the Linked Token.
name: Ammo Blast - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: if a Demon, you die & previously chosen players might die.
flavor: Attack twice by damage of 3 + number of remaining Arcana. Reduce Arcana to 0

otherNightReminder: The Fortify points to a player. They cannot die tonight, mark them with the Safe token. If they chose evil, Fortify is drunk, mark them with the Drunk token.
name: Fortify - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player (not yourself): they can't die tonight. If you chose an evil player, you are drunk.
flavor: Gain 12 Barrier

jinxes.reason: If the Leviathan is in-play, the Fortify-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.
If Riot is in-play, the Fortify-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.

otherNightReminder: The Templar points to 2 players, mark the 1st with the Holy token and the second with the Smote token. If the Demon kills the Holy player and is not the Smote player, the Holy player lives and the Smote player dies.
name: Templar - π
ability: Each night*, choose 2 alive players (not yourself): if the Demon kills the 1st, the 2nd, if not the Demon, dies instead.
flavor: The Lord is with me always. In hardship, in times of distress, times of celebration and times of success.

jinxes.reason: If the Leviathan is in-play, the Templar-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.
If Riot is in-play, the Templar-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.

otherNightReminder: The Encore points to a dead player. They gain their ability tonight and tomorrow. If they chose an evil, they are drunk.
name: Encore - π
ability: Each night*, choose a dead player: gain their ability (if unused) until your next choice. If they were evil, you are drunk until your next choice.
flavor: If previous card on the field is card user's, activate it again

jinxes.reason: If the Encore gains the Butler ability, the Encore learns this.
If the Juggler guesses on their first day and dies before learning, tonight a sober and healthy Encore choosing the Juggler learns how many guesses the Juggler got correct.
If the Poppy Grower died today or before Encore's turn in the night order, evil info only occurs after Encore's turn.
If the Encore gains the Zealot ability, the Encore learns this.

firstNightReminder: During the evil info steps, show Minions and Demons Shadow Pierce's token.
otherNightReminder: Wake the 1st Shadow Pierce. They choose a player, if their choice was the other Shadow Pierce, mark them with the Correct token. Wake the 2nd Shadow Pierce, they point to a player. If their choice was the other Shadow Pierce, mark them with the Correct Token. If both Shadow Pierces have Correct tokens, announce the game has ended and good has won.
name: Shadow Pierce - π
ability: Each night*, if both Shadow Pierces guessed the other, good wins. Evil knows Shadow Pierce is in-play & win if they publicly guess 1. [+1 Shadow Pierce]
flavor: Attack & if there's another card user's card on the field, transform it to Shadow Pierce

jinxes.reason: A Shadow Pierce cannot turn evil.
The Marionette does not learn that the Shadow Pierces are in-play.
A Shadow Pierce cannot turn evil.
If a Pit Hag attempts to create a Shadow Pierce & there are spare tokens, the Storyteller chooses good players equal to spare tokens to become Shadow Pierce.
The Spy may choose to not see the Grimoire. If they do see the Grimoire, evil does not win from correctly guessing a Shadow Pierce.

On the Widow's first night, they may choose to not see the Grimoire. Instead all in-play character tokens are shown to them. They choose 1 of those to poison. If they chose to see the Grimoire, evil does not win from correctly guessing a Shadow Pierce. The Widow cannot choose a Shadow Pierce to poison.

otherNightReminder: Change and run the Mystery Attack's ability.
name: Mystery Attack - π
ability: Each day, you may visit the Storyteller to learn what your ability is tonight & tomorrow.
flavor: At the start of battle: Transform into a random Attack card. Turn back after battle

jinxes.reason: The Mystery Attack when learning their next ability will always receive true information.
The Mystery Attack when learning their next ability will always receive true information.

firstNightReminder: The Overdrive shakes head "no" or points to a player. If they pointed: mark them with the "No Ability" token and show them that players character token. If that player is a Townsfolk, mark them with the Drunk token.
otherNightReminder: If the Overdrive still has their ability: the Overdrive shakes head no or points to a player. Show them that players character token. If that player is a Townsfolk, they are drunk, mark them with the Drunk token.
name: Overdrive - π
ability: Once per game at night, choose a player: learn their character but they are drunk if a Townsfolk, even if you are dead.
flavor: No enemy cards on the field next Phase. Change HP to the number of cards on cooldown x 2

name: Hope - π
ability: Once per game, during the day, privately ask the Storyteller any question & receive some answers (only 1 is correct).
flavor: Recover HP by 8 and gain 4 Barrier

otherNightReminder: If the Spirit was killed by the Demon. Point to all dead evil players.
name: Spirit - π
ability: If the Demon kills you, learn all dead evil players.
flavor: I must go, I must ascend. To the Realm Beyond.

jinxes.reason: Each night*, the Leviathan chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Spirit uses their ability but does not die.
Each night*, Riot chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Spirit uses their ability but does not die.

name: Inverse Strike - π
ability: The 1st time an evil player chooses you with their ability at night, an evil player is chosen instead.
flavor: Attack then reduce cooldown of Magic cards

firstNightReminder: Dont tell the Demon their Minions and Minions their Demon and instead show both parties Tricks Mask's token. Minions then choose a player. If the Demon or Trick Mask, nod "yes" otherwise shake head "no".
otherNightReminder: Minions choose a player. If the Demon or Trick Mask, nod "yes" otherwise shake head "no".
name: Trick Mask - π
ability: Minions & Demons do not know the other. Each night, Minions guess a player: if you or a Demon, they learn this, even if your ability is removed from play.
flavor: Halve opponent Barrier and gain 4 Cover Status

jinxes.reason: If both Trick Mask and Legion are in-play, Legion do not learn each other and, each night, may guess a player as Legion. They learn if they are correct. Trick Mask registers as Legion to this.
If Trick Mask's ability is active, Minions wake each night to choose who babysits Lil' Monsta's token. Non-Minions dont learn they are babysitting Lil' Monsta if it is not alive.
The Magician registers as the Demon to Trick Mask's ability instead of Trick Mask.
The Marionette does not wake with the Minions to guess their Demon and the Demon still knows who the Marionette is.
When the Summoner uses their ability and Trick Mask's ability is active, the Summoner chooses which Demon but the Storyteller chooses which player.
If Trick Mask's ability is active: the Spy does not see the Grimoire.
If Trick Mask’s ability is active: the Widow does not see the Grimoire. Instead all in-play character tokens are shown to them. They choose 1 of those to poison.
Trick Mask’s ability is safe from the Vortox.
Trick Mask’s ability is safe from the Zhobazhbu.

firstNightReminder: Point to up to 2 players.
name: Whisper - π
ability: You start knowing up to 2 players: what happens to you might happen to them & vice versa, even if dead, drunk or poisoned.
flavor: Inflict 3 Sensitive

otherNightReminder: If Stress is dead: choose if a Minion's ability will work twice. If so, wake that Minion, show them the "This character selected you" token and Stress' character token. Mark them with the Works Twice token. Their ability works twice now. Wake Stress, signal them a thumbsup to indicate their ability is in effect.
name: Stress - π
ability: Each night, if you are dead, a Minion's ability might work twice until dusk. You & they learn this.
flavor: Does nothing. Disappears when used or after battle

jinxes.reason: The Marionette does not learn they are affected by Stress' ability.
A Stress boosted Mezepheles cannot create 2 evil players.
If the Summoner's ability works twice due to Stress, the second Demon they create retains their alignment. If the Summoner creates 2 evil Demons, deaths tonight are arbitrary.

firstNightReminder: Point to a player and mark them with the Mad token. If Feint is not marked with the Minion token and that player is a Minion, choose to show them the Minion token and mark Feint with it.
otherNightReminder: Point to a player and mark them with the Mad token. If Feint is not marked with the Minion token and that player is a Minion, choose to show them the Minion token and mark Feint with it.
name: Feint - π
ability: Each night, learn a player. If you aren't mad they are evil tomorrow, one or both of you might die. If you learn a Minion, you might learn this (once).
flavor: Gain 3 Feint Status

otherNightReminder: At the earliest oppurtunity after the Coda's death, wake the Demon. Show them the "This character selected you" token and Coda's token then the character token of the Minion whose ability they have. The Demon now has that ability and you run it like a normal Minion ability.
name: Coda - π
ability: When you die, the Demon gains a Minion ability alongside their own.
flavor: Reduce opponent HP by 5. Reset cooldown of other cards on the field if opponent was defeated by this card

jinxes.reason: If the Demon gains the Baron's ability, up to 2 players become not-in-play Outsiders.
If the Coda is executed and the Demon would gain the Boomdandy's ability, it instead triggers immediately.
If the Coda dies and would give the False Idol's ability, a Minion gains it instead and learns so.
Up to 3 extra players learn that the Grave is in-play. If the Grave's ability is created midgame, those are its targets. If no possible targets, the Grave's ability cannot be put into play.
Up to 3 extra players learn that the Hunter is in-play. If the Hunter's ability is created midgame, those are its targets. If no possible targets, the Hunter's ability cannot be put into play.
If the Demon has a neighbor who can be a Marionette and Coda would give the Marionette ability, they become an evil Marionette. This fails if there is already an extra evil player.
If the Coda dies and would give the Masterminds's ability, a Minion gains it instead and learns so.
If the Coda dies and would give the Scarlet Woman's ability, a Minion gains it alongside their own instead and learns so.
The Demon cannot create an in-play Demon. If they create an out of play Demon, deaths tonight are arbitrary.
If the Coda dies and would give the Vizier's ability, a living Minion gains it alongside their own.

otherNightReminder: If a Trauma just died, wake them and show them "You are" then Trauma's character token. If their character on the Grimoire is not Trauma, take a spare Trauma token and replace their character with it. Mark a Townsfolk with Is Trauma token. They are Trauma now.
name: Trauma - π
ability: When you die, learn your character then a Townsfolk becomes a Trauma, thinks they are a Townsfolk & learns false info.
flavor: Take 4 damage. Disappears from deck when used in Battle. Cannot be lost or dissolved

jinxes.reason: Players turned into Trauma through its ability learn only true info if the Vortox is alive, sober and healthy.

otherNightReminder: If the Showtime died today & 5 or more players that are not Travellers are alive: they point to a player. Mark them with the Target token. If they are not executed tomorrow, the Showtime's team loses.
name: Showtime - π
ability: If you died today or tonight & 5 or more players (excluding Travellers) live, choose an alive player: if they are not executed tomorrow, your team loses.
flavor: Gain 2 Automana status & reduce cooldown of Attack cards by 2

firstNightReminder: Show the Hunter an up to 3 in-play good character tokens. Wake 1 of these players up, show them Hunter's character token and put them to sleep. Repeat until all have woken up.
name: Hunter - π
ability: You start knowing up to 3 in-play good characters (they learn this). If they are all dead, your team wins.
flavor: if you're not willing to obey, then only the end awaits you

jinxes.reason: The Hunter cannot have a Dazzle as their target.
The Hunter cannot have a Exorcist as their target.
The Hunter cannot have a Heretic as their target.
The Hunter cannot have a King as their target.
The Hunter cannot have a Lunatic as their target.
Up to 3 extra players learn that the Hunter is in-play. If the Hunter's ability is created midgame, those are its targets. If no possible targets, the Hunter's ability cannot be put into play.

firstNightReminder: Show each of the Outsider tokens in-play
name: Biter - π
ability: You start knowing which Outsiders are in-play. Dead Outsiders poison 1 Townsfolk neighbor. [-1 or +1 Outsider]
flavor: Chomp Chomp

jinxes.reason: The Heretic starts knowing an out-of-play Outsider & registers as that Outsider to Biter.

firstNightReminder: Show the Grave an up to 3 in-play good character tokens. Wake 1 of these players up, show them Grave's character token and put them to sleep. Repeat until all have woken up
otherNightReminder: The Grave points to as many players as targets. If correct and at least 1 lives, announce that their team has won.
name: Grave - π
ability: You start knowing up to 3 in-play good characters (they learn this). Each night*, if you guess the players & at least 1 lives, your team wins.
flavor: you shall not pass

jinxes.reason: The Grave cannot have a Dazzle as their target.
The Grave cannot have a Exorcist as their target.
The Grave cannot have a Heretic as their target.
The Grave cannot have a King as their target.
The Grave cannot have a Lunatic as their target.
Up to 3 extra players learn that the Grave is in-play. If the Grave's ability is created midgame, those are its targets. If no possible targets, the Grave's ability cannot be put into play.

firstNightReminder: The Hagumoth points to a player. Wake that player, show them the "This character selected you" token and then Hagumoth's character token then put them to sleep. Mark them with the Chosen token. Tomorrow, if they are executed, their team loses.
otherNightReminder: The Hagumoth points to a player. Wake that player, show them the "This character selected you" token and then Hagumoth's character token then put them to sleep. Mark them with the Chosen token. Tomorrow, if they are executed, their team loses.
name: Hagumoth - π
ability: Each night, choose a player: they learn this & if they are executed tomorrow, their team loses.
flavor: Through the path of Umalaaq, I stand upon thy grave. Through the will of the One Beyond, I break thy spirit. Through the ends of Heaven and Hell, I cut thy heart.

jinxes.reason: If the Plague Doctor dies, a living Minion gains the Hagumoth ability in addition to their own and learns this.
The Vizier wakes with the Hagumoth, learns who they choose and cannot choose to immediately execute that player tomorrow.

otherNightReminder: The Tyrant points to a player. That player dies. If the Demon is marked with the Overthrown token, they do not wake tonight. If they do not, wake them as normal and then mark them with the Overthrown token.
name: Tyrant - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. The Demon wakes every other night, even if you are dead, drunk or poisoned.
flavor: We shall dance, challenger

jinxes.reason: The Tyrant registers as the Demon to the Banshee.
The Lil' Monsta's ability does not kill every other day/night cycle.
The Tyrant registers as the Demon to the Monk.
If the Tyrant kills the Sage, the Sage learns the Demon is 1 of 2 players.
The Tyrant registers as the Demon to the Spirit.
The Yaggababble's ability does not kill every other day/night cycle.
If the Tyrant is in-play, the Zombuul instead wakes every other night that no player died that day.

firstNightReminder: Mark the Enra with both Has Ability tokens. The Enra shakes head "no" or points to a player. Wake that player up, show them the "This character selected you" token and Enra's character token then put them to sleep. They have no ability, move the Has Ability token to them and rotate it upside-down.
otherNightReminder: If the Enra has their ability: the Enra shakes head "no" or points to a player. Wake that player up, show them the "This character selected you" token and Enra's character token then put them to sleep. They have no ability, move the Has Ability token to them and rotate it upside-down.
name: Enra - π
ability: Twice per game at night, choose a player: they learn this & have no ability. If you have no ability, chosen players might regain theirs at any time.
flavor: ... And it shall be our duty to slay the children of the wretched witch as our only way to reply to her sins

firstNightReminder: Mark the Corrupted with both Has Ability tokens.
otherNightReminder: Every night but the first, if the Corrupted has its ability: the Corrupted shakes head "no" or points to 2 players. Mark the first player with the Choice 1 token and the second with the Choice 2 token. Remove a Has Ability token from Corrupted. Announce "The Corrupted has chosen" the first player's name "and" the second player's name. "After a countdown from 10, if most players have their hand up, the first player dies and if most players have their hand down, the second player dies. The Corrupted breaks ties." Start the countdown. When the countdown reaches 0, tally the results silently. The player with the most votes dies, mark them with the Dead token, and the other is now alive, remove any existing shroud.
name: Corrupted - π
ability: Twice per game, at night*, choose 2 players (all learn which): after a 10 to 1 countdown, the player with the most votes dies & the other lives, you break ties.
flavor: Do not worry, your death will be swift and painless

firstNightReminder: Wake all Marusok 1 by 1. Show them each a not in-play Demon ability and replace their tokens with the corresponding Demon. Mark them with the Is Marusok tokens.
name: Marusok - π
ability: You have a not-in-play Demon ability and register as that Demon too. Evil players might not wake. [All Minions are Marusok]
flavor: I am the Infinite Spiral, the herald of The One Beyond. What are you?

jinxes.reason: Corr. Sylphy's ability only checks the last night they woke.
If the Engineer successfully creates Marusok, all Minions become Marusok.
Marusok can be invited alongside a Demon. If it is, all Minions become Marusok except the Invitee, who becomes the invited Demon.
The Kazali may choose Marusok's Demon abilities. If they made a Marusok, all Minions become Marusok.
If Marusok has the Legion ability, other Marusok might have it as well. The Demon might be Legion too.
Demons may choose to not attack when they wake. If the Po wakes and the last Demon to wake chose to not attack, they choose 3 players.
The Summoner may choose to create Marusok as well as their Demon. If they do, all Minions become Marusok and the Summoner-chosen player becomes the chosen Demon.

firstNightReminder: Place the Stage token 5 spaces anti-clockwise to False Idol
otherNightReminder: Move the Stage token 1 step clockwise. If it reaches False Idol, announce that the game is over and that evil has won.
name: False Idol - π
ability: After day 6, evil wins. Good can't win by killing the Demon.
flavor: LISTEN TO ME, WATCH ME, LOVE ME!

jinxes.reason: A dead False Idol cannot stop good from winning through killing the Demon.
A dead False Idol cannot stop good from winning through killing the Demon.
A dead False Idol cannot stop good from winning through killing the Demon.

firstNightReminder: Madeline's clockwise Townsfolk neighbor is poisoned.
otherNightReminder: Madeline's next clockwise Townsfolk neighbor is poisoned unless 3 players are already poisoned this way. Wake them later when Demons normally wake to point to a player. That player dies.
name: Madeline - π
ability: Each night, the next Townsfolk closest clockwise to you is poisoned until 3 are. Each night*, choose a player: they die.
flavor: If only you knew your place! But its too late now!

firstNightReminder: Announce to everyone all of the Hand of Fate's abilities. Later, the Hand of Fate signals a number. Note it down and show them the card with the ability they now have.
otherNightReminder: The Hand of Fate signals a number. Note it down and show them the card with the ability they now have. After they are done: they shake their head "no" then point to a player. That player dies.
name: Hand of Fate - π
ability: Each night, choose a number: gain that ability. Each night*, choose a player: they die. All players start knowing your abilities.
flavor: the time has come for you to return where you belong

firstNightReminder: Wake all Minions and show them the Invitation Letter's token. They will point to a player. If they do not come to a decision, choose a player. Wake that player, give them the Invitation Letter's token and mark them with the Invitee token. Place the Day 1 Token in the center of the Grimoire.
otherNightReminder: Place the next Day token in the centre of the Grimoire. Wake all Minions. They will point to a player. Wake that player, give them the Invitation Letter's token and mark them with the Invitee token. If it is Day 3, wake them. They choose a Demon. If they choose Invitation Letter motion them to choose again. When they make their choice, show them the "Your character is" card and the Demon they chose. Change their token in the Grimoire to reflect that and remove the Invitation Letter reminders and tokens. You may need to rotate their token if they are good.
name: Invitation Letter - π
ability: Each night, Minions choose who holds the Invitation Letter's token. On night 3, the invitee chooses a Demon to become. [+1 Minion]
flavor:
Greetings to whomever receives this letter. 

You have been invited to be the VIP guest of the Great Party at Midnight being held on the 3rd night of the Black Moon! 
All costs will be covered by our generous Host*. Entertainment includes: singing, dancing, darts, music, talking, murdering the guests (only after the clock strikes 3), betrayal. Please bring your own Demon horns and ornamental mask. 



*Costs covered do not include travel fees, legal fees, hospital fees, bail. By attending this party you hereby acknowledge that The Followers of the One Beyond will not be held liable for any injuries, diseases, murder, arson, loss of sanity, loss of kidneys, and that you, the holder of the letter, consent to having your insides violently ripped out and replaced by the unholy offspring of our Lord.

jinxes.reason: If the Invitation Letter is in-play, the Clockmaker does not receive their info until a Demon is successfully invited.
If the Cult is invited, most players (including all evil players) become evil Cultists. If the Cult wins and they were invited, they must do the macarena.

If the Engineer removes the Invitation Letter from play, the Invitee becomes the chosen Demon. If the Engineer creates the Invitation Letter before night 4, the Demon becomes a not-in-play Minion Invitee. Otherwise nothing happens.
If the Hatter dies, the Invitee can choose a Demon to become. If the Demon chooses Invitation Letter, they also choose a Minion to become and are the Invitee.
If Legion is invited, most players (including all evil players) become evil Legion.
If Lord of Typhon is invited, one of the Invitee's neighbors becomes an evil Lord of Typhon.
Each night, the Magician chooses a Minion: if that Minion & the Invitation Letter are alive, that Minion is the Invitee.
The Marionette neighbors a Minion, not the Demon. The Marionette is not woken to choose who takes the Invitation Letter's token.
If the Poppy Grower is in-play, Minions don't wake together. They are woken one by one, until one of them chooses to be the Invitee.
The Invitee may choose to invite Pukka on night 2.

If Trick Mask’s ability is active and the Invitation Letter is alive, Minions do not learn each other and are instead woken 1 by 1 until 1 of them chooses to take the Invitation letter’s token. After a Demon is invited, Minions learn each other.
The Vizier can die by execution if they are the Invitee.
On night 3, if a dead player becomes the Invitee, they may choose to invite Zombuul. If they do, they become a Zombuul that has died once.

otherNightReminder: Estelle points to a player. That player dies. If that player was a Minion, they keep their ability and point to a player. That player dies.
name: Estelle - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. Minions you kill keep their ability and choose a player: they die.
flavor: No... Please stop. I don't want to hurt you

otherNightReminder: Signal (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) how many players Corr. Sylphy can point to. They point to that many players. Those players die and mark Corr. Sylphy with a Kill Chain token unless they already have 4.
name: Corr. Sylphy - π
ability: Each night*, choose 1 more player than last night (up to 5): they die. If a Minion died today, choose 1 instead.
flavor: Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor Traitor...

firstNightReminder: Show Time - Sixth all the events and they point to 1. Announce that event to everyone. Place the Final Hour token an equivalent steps anti-clockwise to Time - Sixth as the day of the event - 1 and mark Time - Sixth with as many New Day tokens as Final Hour reaches Time - Sixth prematurely.
otherNightReminder: Time - Sixth points to a player. That player dies. Move the Final Hour token 1 step clockwise. If it reaches Time - Sixth, remove a New Day token. If there are none, the event happens.
name: Time - Sixth - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. On your 1st night, choose from a list of events. All players learn your choice.
flavor: I gave your kind a chance. But it turned out to be a waste of time.

firstNightReminder: Wake the Destiny if you need or want.
otherNightReminder: The Destiny points to a player. That player dies. They may signal or text you their prediction.
name: Destiny - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. Once per game, you may make a prediction: if accepted, it will come true with consequences.
flavor: The world is MINE to shape.

otherNightReminder: The Plank of Wood points to a player. That player dies.
name: Plank of Wood - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. If only 3 players live (excluding Travellers) & an execution occurs, evil wins. Otherwise good wins.
flavor: *Plank of Wood noises*

otherNightReminder: Remove the Purged token from the Grimoire. The Zhobazhbu points to a player. That player dies and the Purged token is removed. If that player was a Minion, they keep their ability and Townsfolk abilities yield false information until Zhobazhbu chooses again, mark that Minion with the Purged token.
name: Zhobazhbu - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. Minions you kill keep their ability & Townsfolk abilities yield false info until you choose again. [-1 Outsider]
flavor:
By the Blessed Flame...
Endless Carnage unleash...
At Hells behest...
... purify the accursed.
... to purge the Nightmare.
... you are reborn!

jinxes.reason: If a Minion was Purged and the Demon kills the Banshee, players still learn that the Banshee has died.

otherNightReminder: The Sabnock points to a player. That player dies. If they were an Outsider, their Townsfolk neighbor closer to Sabnock is poisoned, mark them with a Poisoned token.
name: Sabnock - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. Outsiders you kill poison their Townsfolk neighbor closest to you. If equidistant, it is arbitrary. [+1 Outsider]
flavor: Attrape des vers, salope.

firstNightReminder: Mark Time - Ninth with the Day 1 token.
otherNightReminder: If Time - Ninth is marked with the Day 3 token: kill Townsfolk equitable to dead Minions. If their ability would end the game, you choose who dies. Time - Ninth points to a player. That player dies.
name: Time - Ninth - π
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. After day 3, Townsfolk proportional to dead Minions die. If your ability would end the game: deaths tonight are arbitrary.
flavor: You cannot stop time. All you can do is run away from this reality. How far will you run away this time I wonder?

firstNightReminder: Choose the day evil will win. Announce it to everyone. Place the Break Point that many spaces to anti-clockwise to Fall. Charlotte - 1 and mark Fall. Charlotte with as many New Cycle tokens as the Break Point token reaches Fall. Charlotte prematurely.
otherNightReminder: Move the Break Point token one step clockwise. If it reaches Fall. Charlotte, remove a New Cycle token. If there are none, evil wins.
name: Fall. Charlotte - π
ability: All players start knowing a day. After that day, at dusk, evil wins. For every nomination, that day comes closer by 1 (2 if Demon nominee).

jinxes.reason: Each night*, Fall. Charlotte chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Banshee dies & gains their ability.
If the Exorcist chooses Fall. Charlotte, tomorrow failed nominations do not bring the final day closer.
Each night*, Fall. Charlotte chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Farmer uses their ability but does not die.
If Fall. Charlotte is in-play, the Fortify-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.
If Fall. Charlotte is in-play and the Grandchild was nominated, the final day comes closer by 2 instead of 1.
If Fall. Charlotte is in-play, the Innkeeper-protected players are safe from all evil abilities.
If Fall. Charlotte is in-play, and at least 1 player is dead, the King learns an alive character each night.
If Fall. Charlotte and Mayor are both in-play and no execution occurs on the final day, good wins instead.
If Fall. Charlotte is in-play, the Monk-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.
Each night*, Fall. Charlotte chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Ravenkeeper uses their ability but does not die.
Each night*, Fall. Charlotte chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Sage uses their ability but does not die.
If Fall. Charlotte is in-play, the Soldier is safe from all evil abilities.
Each night*, Fall. Charlotte chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Spirit uses their ability but does not die.
If Fall. Charlotte is in-play, the Templar-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.

otherNightReminder: Players might die at any time
name: Cultist - π
ability: Players might die at any time. Evil votes secretly don't count & a 50% majority is not required. You register as a Minion too. [Most players are Cultists]
flavor: For centuries we have been watching and waiting for a sign, embedding ourselves in the most prestigious of positions and the lowest trenches of society. Now we have been blessed with the Revelation from the One Beyond. Have you not woken?

jinxes.reason: Cultists and the Engineer can not both be in-play at the start of the game. If the Engineer creates a Culist, most players (including all evil players) become evil Cultists.
If the Hatter dies and a Cultist is in-play, nothing happens. If the Hatter dies and an evil player chooses Cultist, all current evil players become Cultists.
If a Cultist died by execution today, Cultists keeps their ability, but the Minstrel might learn they are a Cultist.
If the Preacher chooses a Cultist, They keep their ability, but the Preacher might learn they are a Cultist.
If the Summoner creates a Cultist, most players (including all evil players) become evil Cultists.
If both Trick Mask and Cultists are in-play, Cultists do not learn each other and may guess a player is a Cultist. Trick Mask registers as a Cultist to this.
